page.title: 06Caerphilly Castle-History
page.content: This moated{Norman castle, with its well-preserved walls and towers, particularly the leaning tower, is an important tourist attraction.In 1984, Â£28,000 was collected in admission fees. Cadw, a branch of the Welsh Office, on behalf of the Secretary of State for Wales, looks after the preservation and renovation of the castle which is a{Welsh Historic {Monument. The great hall is in excellent repair and was appropriately renovated and decorated for the 700th. anniversary of the beginning of the castle. The cost was borne by the Friends of Caerphilly, local organisations and some individuals. Firms gave the materials and much of the decorative work was done by school children and their teachers.
